00001 #include <screen/screen.h>
00002 
00003 static unsigned int g_screenMode;
00004 
00005 static unsigned int g_screenWidth;
00006 static unsigned int g_screenHeight;
00007 
00012 void initializeScreen()
00013 {
00014         //The screen starts in text mode (The BIOS & GRUB should see to that)
00015         g_screenMode = MODE_TEXTMODE;
00016 
00017         //Default/Standard = 80x25 text mode on boot - //TODO: Detect/Set the screen mode prior to setting these values
00018         g_screenWidth = 80;
00019         g_screenHeight = 25;
00020 
00021         //Clear any rubbish left on the screen by the bootloader/BIOS/Anything that came before the kernel
00022         text_mode_clearscreen();
00023 }
00024 
00025 //Get the screen mode
00026 unsigned int getScreenMode()
00027 {
00028         return g_screenMode;
00029 }
00030 
00031 //Get a screen attribute (Width, height, Mode, etc)
00032 unsigned int getScreenAttribute(unsigned int ID)
00033 {
00034         switch (ID)
00035         {
00036                 case SCREEN_MODE:
00037                 {
00038                         return g_screenMode;
00039                 }
00040 
00041                 case SCREEN_WIDTH:
00042                 {
00043                         return g_screenWidth;
00044                 }
00045 
00046                 case SCREEN_HEIGHT:
00047                 {
00048                         return g_screenHeight;
00049                 }
00050                 
00051                 default:
00052                         return 0;
00053         }
00054 }
